abortion.notes: P&G's ESG policy pages do not include reproductive rights as a stated corporate policy issue.

lgbtq_rights.notes: P&G earns perfect HRC Corporate Equality Index score for LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion.; P&G's equality and inclusion page highlights LGBTQ+ commitments including inclusive benefits, ERGs, and advertisin

racial_justice.notes: P&G CEO David Taylor's statement affirming Black Lives Matter and pledging $5M+ to racial justice causes.; P&G's 'Widen the Screen' initiative to expand representation of Black creators in advertising

immigration.notes: P&G, as a Business Roundtable member, is part of a group advocating for immigration reform including DACA protections.

religious_liberty.notes: P&G's Code of Conduct prohibits discrimination based on religion.

death_penalty.notes: P&G has not issued any public statement on capital punishment.

workers_rights.notes: P&G's Supplier Responsibility standards require suppliers to respect ILO labor rights including freedom of association and fair wages.

minimum_wage.notes: P&G's LDA lobbying filings include labor cost policy among issues lobbied.

corporate_tax.notes: Business Roundtable (P&G member) advocates for competitive corporate tax rates to maintain US economic competitiveness.

free_trade.notes: P&G's lobbying disclosures include trade policy as a priority area.

climate_change.notes: P&G's climate strategy commits to carbon neutrality by 2040, including Scope 1, 2, and material Scope 3 emissions.; P&G is a RE100 member, committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity.

renewable_energy.notes: P&G committed to 100% renewable electricity as a RE100 member and has signed multiple wind and solar PPAs.

environmental_regulations.notes: P&G supports sustainable packaging regulations and extended producer responsibility frameworks.

animal_rights.notes: P&G's animal research policy acknowledges ongoing animal testing for safety while committing to developing non-animal alternatives.; Cruelty Free International continues to criticize P&G for animal te

gun_control.notes: P&G has not taken a public position on gun policy.

military_spending.notes: P&G has no public stance on defense or military spending.

police_reform.notes: P&G CEO David Taylor statement following George Floyd murder, pledging commitment to racial equity.

drug_policy.notes: P&G has no public stance on drug policy reform.

universal_healthcare.notes: P&G provides comprehensive health benefits to employees worldwide.

education_funding.notes: P&G's community investment includes education funding through the P&G Fund.

student_debt.notes: P&G has not issued public statements on student loan debt policy.

vaccine_policy.notes: P&G was among major corporations requiring COVID-19 vaccines for office employees in 2021.

abortion.notes: Unilever publishes an A-Z list of public positions. Abortion is not listed. No CEO or corporate statement found taking a position on abortion access or legislation.

lgbtq_rights.notes: Unilever's ED&I strategy explicitly opposes marginalisation of individuals 'simply because of who they are', covering gender identity and sexual orientation. Company markets inclusive campaigns global

racial_justice.notes: Unilever commissioned independent research into William Lever's colonial-era forced labour plantations (DRC, Solomon Islands), stating 'We abhor all forms of racism, discrimination or worker abuse.' E

immigration.notes: Immigration is not listed among Unilever's public positions. As a global employer in 190+ countries, Unilever has not taken a formal public stance on immigration policy.

religious_liberty.notes: Religious liberty not addressed in Unilever's public positions. Company's non-discrimination policy does cover religion in the workplace as a protected characteristic.

death_penalty.notes: Unilever has not published a position on the death penalty. No evidence of lobbying or public statements on capital punishment found.

workers_rights.notes: Human rights position explicitly states: 'committed to safe and healthy working conditions, the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining, and to effective information and consultation

minimum_wage.notes: Unilever's Living Wage Promise requires suppliers to assess the gap between what they pay and a living wage, and take steps to close it. The program goes beyond minimum wage to a living wage standard.

corporate_tax.notes: Unilever is a multinational listed on LSE, Euronext Amsterdam and NYSE with operations across 190 countries. No public position on corporate tax rates found. As a major multinational, Unilever uses st

free_trade.notes: Unilever sells products in over 190 countries and has a global supply chain. As one of the world's largest consumer goods companies, it benefits from and generally supports free trade frameworks, thou

climate_change.notes: Unilever has achieved 72% reduction in Scope 1 & 2 GHG emissions since 2015. Has a published Climate Transition Action Plan. Advocates for government policies to accelerate clean energy transition glo

renewable_energy.notes: Unilever prioritizes renewable electricity and energy efficiency in operations. Has achieved major reductions in Scope 1 & 2 emissions through renewable energy. Calls on governments to accelerate clea

environmental_regulations.notes: Explicitly states: 'Governments, regulators and industry must move further and faster in creating the enabling environments needed for companies like ours to meet climate targets.' Pushes for policies

animal_rights.notes: Animal testing position: 'We do not test on animals and believe that animal testing is not needed.' Proactively shares non-animal safety approaches. Animal welfare: 100% cage-free eggs in Europe and N

gun_control.notes: Gun control is not addressed in Unilever's A-Z position statements. No corporate statements or lobbying activity on firearms policy found.

military_spending.notes: Military spending not addressed in Unilever's public positions. No evidence of lobbying or public statements on defense budgets found.

police_reform.notes: Police reform not addressed in Unilever's public positions. Ben & Jerry's (Unilever sub-brand) has spoken on racial justice but parent company has not made a direct statement on police reform.

drug_policy.notes: Drug policy not addressed in Unilever's public positions. No evidence of lobbying or public statements on drug decriminalization or enforcement policy found.

universal_healthcare.notes: No public position on universal healthcare or health insurance systems found. Unilever does provide health benefits to employees globally but has not advocated for specific national healthcare policie

education_funding.notes: No explicit public position on government education funding. Unilever does run training and capability-building programs in its supply chain (e.g. for farmers) but has not taken a policy stance on pub

student_debt.notes: No public position on student debt relief or cancellation found. Unilever has not lobbied or issued statements on US student loan policy.

vaccine_policy.notes: No public stance on vaccine mandates or public health vaccination policy found. Unilever has stated commitment to employee wellbeing but has not publicly advocated on specific vaccine mandate policies

abortion.notes: NestlÃ©'s sustainability reporting covers environmental and social topics but does not include abortion policy.

lgbtq_rights.notes: NestlÃ©'s diversity and inclusion framework includes LGBTQ+ employees in its commitment to a respectful workplace.; NestlÃ© has appeared on Stonewall's Global Diversity List for LGBTQ+ workplace inclu

racial_justice.notes: NestlÃ©'s diversity commitments include racial and ethnic representation goals.; NestlÃ© announced renaming of some ice cream brands following racial stereotyping criticism in 2020.

immigration.notes: NestlÃ©'s inclusion policies emphasize diverse nationality and culture but don't address immigration policy.

religious_liberty.notes: NestlÃ©'s Human Rights Policy prohibits discrimination based on religion.

death_penalty.notes: NestlÃ© has no public stance on capital punishment.

workers_rights.notes: Washington Post investigation documenting child labor in NestlÃ©'s cocoa supply chain in West Africa, finding children as young as 12 doing hazardous work.; NestlÃ©'s Responsible Sourcing commitments

minimum_wage.notes: NestlÃ©'s commitment to living wages for direct employees by 2030.

corporate_tax.notes: The Guardian Paradise Papers coverage revealed NestlÃ©'s use of tax haven structures.

free_trade.notes: NestlÃ©'s investor relations material emphasizes global operations and supply chains dependent on open trade.

climate_change.notes: NestlÃ©'s net zero roadmap commits to 2050 net zero with SBTi-approved 50% reduction by 2030.; CDP rates NestlÃ©'s climate disclosure and action.

renewable_energy.notes: NestlÃ©'s renewable electricity target of 100% by 2025 as part of its emissions reduction strategy.

environmental_regulations.notes: Guardian investigation into NestlÃ©'s water extraction in Michigan, drawing water near Flint during its water crisis.; NestlÃ©'s water stewardship commitments and claims of responsible water use.

animal_rights.notes: NestlÃ©'s Farm Animal Welfare Policy commits to Five Freedoms but permits industrial farming practices.; World Animal Protection's factory farming campaign identifies NestlÃ© as a major buyer of facto

gun_control.notes: NestlÃ©, as a Swiss company, has not taken a public stance on US gun policy.

military_spending.notes: NestlÃ© has no public stance on military spending.

police_reform.notes: NestlÃ© has not made significant public statements on police reform or racial justice in the United States specifically. The company's diversity commitments are primarily internal-facing.

drug_policy.notes: NestlÃ© has no public stance on drug policy reform.

universal_healthcare.notes: NestlÃ©, headquartered in Switzerland where universal healthcare exists, has not taken positions on US healthcare policy. The company provides health benefits to employees but has not advocated for un

education_funding.notes: NestlÃ© Foundation focuses on nutrition science research and food security education.

student_debt.notes: NestlÃ© has not issued public statements on student loan debt policy.

vaccine_policy.notes: NestlÃ©'s COVID-19 response included encouraging employee vaccination and following public health guidelines.

abortion.notes: PepsiCo's public policy engagement page does not list reproductive rights as a priority issue.

lgbtq_rights.notes: PepsiCo earns HRC Corporate Equality Index score of 100 (Equality 100 Award) for LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion policies.; PepsiCo's 'Inclusion for Growth' strategy explicitly includes LGBTQ+ employees in

racial_justice.notes: $400M, 5-year commitment to uplift Black and Hispanic communities across talent, suppliers, communities.; PepsiCo Inclusion for Growth strategy includes racial equity as a core pillar.

immigration.notes: PepsiCo is a member of the Business Roundtable, which signed a letter urging Congress to protect DACA recipients.; PepsiCo's diversity and inclusion strategy encompasses global workforce diversity, im

religious_liberty.notes: PepsiCo's Code of Conduct prohibits discrimination on the basis of religion among other protected categories.

death_penalty.notes: Public policy engagement focuses on food, agriculture, trade, recycling, environmental sustainability, and AI â€” no mention of capital punishment.

workers_rights.notes: PepsiCo's Human Rights policy commits to fair pay, safe conditions, freedom of association, and supply chain due diligence based on UN Guiding Principles.; PepsiCo reports annual pay equity analysis a

minimum_wage.notes: PepsiCo's LDA lobbying filings include labor and wage policy among lobbying issues.; PepsiCo prioritizes lobbying on food, trade, and regulatory topics including labor cost issues; opposes discriminat

corporate_tax.notes: Business Roundtable (of which PepsiCo is a member) has advocated for maintaining competitive corporate tax rates.; PepsiCo's federal lobbying disclosures include tax policy as an issue area.

free_trade.notes: PepsiCo lists 'trade' among its key public policy issues for 2024, consistent with a global company favoring free trade agreements.

climate_change.notes: PepsiCo's Climate Transition Plan outlines net zero by 2040, requiring 40% reduction in absolute GHG emissions across Scopes 1, 2, and 3 by 2030.; Detailed Climate Transition Plan calling for governme

renewable_energy.notes: PepsiCo committed to 100% renewable electricity by 2030 and has signed power purchase agreements for wind and solar. RE100 member.

environmental_regulations.notes: PepsiCo's climate strategy acknowledges dependence on external enablers including 'Government policy that incentivizes and/or mandates climate action.'; PepsiCo supports recycling regulations and exte

animal_rights.notes: PepsiCo Animal Welfare policy covers farm animal treatment standards and cage-free egg commitments.

gun_control.notes: PepsiCo's public policy priorities do not include gun control legislation.

military_spending.notes: PepsiCo has no public stance on defense or military spending as a consumer goods company.

police_reform.notes: CEO Laguarta spoke out on systemic racism and committed $400M to address racial inequities following George Floyd's murder.

drug_policy.notes: PepsiCo has no documented public stance on drug policy reform.

universal_healthcare.notes: PepsiCo provides comprehensive employee health and wellness benefits.

education_funding.notes: PepsiCo Foundation invests in education, including scholarships and STEM programs in underserved communities.

student_debt.notes: PepsiCo has not issued public statements on student loan policy or debt forgiveness.

vaccine_policy.notes: PepsiCo prioritized employee health during COVID-19, offering vaccination support and paid time off.

abortion.notes: Coca-Cola's press release archive shows public engagement on voting rights, racial equity, and sustainability but not on abortion policy.

lgbtq_rights.notes: Coca-Cola earns perfect HRC Corporate Equality Index score for LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion.; Coca-Cola's diversity and inclusion commitments explicitly cover LGBTQ+ employees and communities.

racial_justice.notes: CEO James Quincey publicly stated the Georgia voter restriction law 'is wrong' and 'does not match our values' in April 2021.; Coca-Cola committed $500M toward racial equity initiatives including supp

immigration.notes: As a Business Roundtable member, Coca-Cola is part of a group that called on Congress to protect DACA recipients.

religious_liberty.notes: Coca-Cola's Human Rights Policy prohibits discrimination based on religion among other protected characteristics.

death_penalty.notes: Coca-Cola has not issued any public statement on capital punishment.

workers_rights.notes: Coca-Cola's Human Rights Policy commits to ILO labor standards including freedom of association and fair wages.; Business & Human Rights Resource Centre documents multiple allegations of labor rights

minimum_wage.notes: Coca-Cola's federal lobbying disclosures include labor cost-related policy areas.

corporate_tax.notes: Reuters coverage of Coca-Cola's $12B IRS tax dispute over royalty payments, illustrating company's use of tax minimization strategies.

free_trade.notes: Coca-Cola's global operations across 200+ countries reflect its interest in maintaining free trade.

climate_change.notes: Coca-Cola has set a 1.5Â°C emissions target by 2035, water replenishment goals, and packaging reduction targets.

renewable_energy.notes: Coca-Cola's sustainability targets include renewable energy procurement as part of its 1.5Â°C emissions pathway.

environmental_regulations.notes: Coca-Cola's water replenishment and packaging reduction commitments align with and support environmental regulation.

animal_rights.notes: Coca-Cola's ingredient sustainability focuses on agriculture and water, with limited specific animal welfare commitments.

gun_control.notes: Coca-Cola has not taken a public position on gun policy despite being headquartered in Georgia, where gun laws are politically prominent.

military_spending.notes: Coca-Cola has no public stance on defense or military spending.

police_reform.notes: Coca-Cola committed $500M toward racial equity after the murder of George Floyd, with CEO Quincey calling for systemic change.

drug_policy.notes: Coca-Cola has no public stance on drug policy reform. The company does not produce alcoholic or cannabis beverages in the US market.

universal_healthcare.notes: Coca-Cola provides health and wellness benefits to all employees globally.

education_funding.notes: Coca-Cola Foundation has invested over $1 billion in educational programs and scholarships worldwide.

student_debt.notes: Coca-Cola has not issued a public statement on student loan debt forgiveness or federal student debt policy.

vaccine_policy.notes: Coca-Cola was among companies requiring COVID-19 vaccines for office employees in 2021.

abortion.notes: J&J's global health equity focus includes access to healthcare broadly but does not specify abortion policy.; J&J was reported among companies offering abortion travel benefits to employees after the

lgbtq_rights.notes: J&J earns perfect HRC Corporate Equality Index score for LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion policies.; J&J's social impact page includes LGBTQ+ inclusion as a component of its diversity and equity commitments

racial_justice.notes: J&J's Global Health Equity initiative addresses racial and health disparities, backed by $100M commitment.; J&J announced a $100M commitment in 2020 to advance racial equity in health and business.

immigration.notes: J&J, as a Business Roundtable member, is part of advocacy for immigration reform including DACA protections and skilled worker visas.

religious_liberty.notes: J&J's Credo commits to fair treatment for all employees regardless of religion.

death_penalty.notes: The Guardian reported J&J drugs being traced to state execution protocols, raising questions about corporate responsibility.

workers_rights.notes: J&J's Credo (foundational document) commits to fair wages, safe working conditions, and employee dignity.; J&J's Responsible Supply Base standards require suppliers to respect fundamental labor rights

minimum_wage.notes: J&J has not taken a clear public position on federal minimum wage increases. As a primarily professional/healthcare employer, the issue affects its supply chain more than direct operations.

corporate_tax.notes: J&J's LDA lobbying filings include tax policy as an issue area.

free_trade.notes: J&J's lobbying activities include trade policy supporting open markets for pharmaceutical products.

climate_change.notes: J&J is committed to net zero by 2045, with science-based interim targets and CDP A-list recognition.; J&J's Health for Humanity report details climate targets and environmental performance.

renewable_energy.notes: J&J is a RE100 member targeting 100% renewable electricity by 2025 with signed wind and solar PPAs.

environmental_regulations.notes: J&J's environmental sustainability approach supports regulatory frameworks for climate and water.

animal_rights.notes: J&J's Responsible Research page outlines animal testing practices and 3Rs commitments, confirming ongoing animal testing for medical/pharmaceutical development.

gun_control.notes: J&J focuses on health equity issues including community violence but has not specifically advocated for gun control legislation.

military_spending.notes: J&J has no public stance on military spending as a civilian healthcare company.

police_reform.notes: J&J $100M racial equity commitment with focus on health equity and systemic racism.

drug_policy.notes: J&J faced litigation over its role in the opioid epidemic as a manufacturer and distributor.; J&J's lobbying disclosures include drug pricing and pharmaceutical regulation as priority issues.

universal_healthcare.notes: J&J's social impact mission focuses on improving healthcare access for all, consistent with supporting broader coverage.; J&J's Global Health Equity work explicitly aims to expand access to healthcare

education_funding.notes: J&J Foundation's nursing initiative provides substantial education funding to train nursing professionals worldwide.

student_debt.notes: J&J has not issued public statements on student loan debt policy.

vaccine_policy.notes: FDA Emergency Use Authorization for J&J's (Janssen) single-dose COVID-19 vaccine, February 2021.; J&J announcement of COVID-19 vaccine development and commitment to vaccine access globally.

lgbtq_rights.notes: In June 2019, Kraft Heinz achieved a 100 percent Corporate Equality Index (CEI) score from the Human Rights Campaign. Wikipedia notes this recognized Kraft Heinz 'for its LGBTQ inclusion efforts and b

racial_justice.notes: Kraft Heinz's 2020 Strategic Transformation Plan included a new ESG report. Company has diversity and inclusion programs. Made public statements after 2020 racial justice events. Has participated in i

immigration.notes: No public position on immigration policy found. Kraft Heinz employs workers in many countries and has supply chains in diverse geographies but has not issued statements on immigration legislation.

religious_liberty.notes: No public position on religious liberty legislation found.

death_penalty.notes: No public position on capital punishment found.

workers_rights.notes: Kraft Heinz has faced criticism for aggressive cost-cutting since the 3G Capital/Berkshire Hathaway merger approach, including significant workforce reductions. No strong public advocacy for labor rig

minimum_wage.notes: No public position on minimum wage legislation found. Under Berkshire Hathaway's influence, Kraft Heinz has generally avoided public policy advocacy on wage issues.

corporate_tax.notes: No explicit public stance on corporate tax rates. Warren Buffett (Berkshire Hathaway) has personally expressed support for higher taxes on the wealthy, but Kraft Heinz as a corporation has not taken a

free_trade.notes: Kraft Heinz is the world's fifth-largest food and beverage company with operations across North America, South America, Europe, Asia, and Australia. Benefits from global trade but no explicit advocacy

climate_change.notes: In September 2020, Kraft Heinz released its updated ESG report with goals to make 100% of product packaging recyclable, reusable, or compostable by 2025 and to sustainably source 100% of Heinz Ketchup

renewable_energy.notes: Kraft Heinz ESG report mentions energy efficiency and sustainability goals, but specific renewable energy transition targets are less prominent than competitors like Unilever and General Mills. Some r

gun_control.notes: No public position on gun control or firearms legislation found.

military_spending.notes: No public position on military spending or defense budgets found.

police_reform.notes: No public position on police reform found.

drug_policy.notes: No public position on drug decriminalization or drug enforcement policy found.

universal_healthcare.notes: No public position on universal healthcare found. Kraft Heinz provides comprehensive healthcare benefits to employees including LGBTQ+ health coverage (as evidenced by 100% HRC CEI score), but has not

education_funding.notes: No public position on government education funding policy found.

student_debt.notes: No public position on student debt cancellation or college affordability policy found.

vaccine_policy.notes: No public advocacy stance on vaccine mandates found. During COVID-19, Kraft Heinz implemented health protocols but did not publicly advocate on vaccine mandate policy.

abortion.notes: General Mills has not issued any public statement or policy position on abortion access or abortion legislation. No lobbying activity on abortion found in publicly available records.

lgbtq_rights.notes: General Mills lists 'Champion Belonging' as one of four core corporate values. Company has established LGBTQ employee networks (over 25 years old), inclusive advertising campaigns featuring same-sex c

racial_justice.notes: General Mills 'Championing Belonging' program explicitly addresses racial inclusion. 'Courageous Conversations' platform for employees on challenging topics. Company made public statements supporting

immigration.notes: No public position on immigration policy found. General Mills employs workers in many countries but has not issued statements on immigration law or border policy.

religious_liberty.notes: Religion is included as a protected characteristic under General Mills' belonging framework but no public policy position on religious liberty legislation has been found.

death_penalty.notes: No public position on capital punishment found. General Mills has not lobbied or issued statements on death penalty legislation.

workers_rights.notes: General Mills publishes a human rights statement and Slavery and Human Trafficking Statement. Company lists human rights as a key pillar, including worker protections in supply chain.; General Mills i

minimum_wage.notes: No public position on federal or state minimum wage levels found. General Mills has not lobbied for or against minimum wage increases based on publicly available records.

corporate_tax.notes: No explicit public stance on corporate tax rates. As a Fortune 500 company listed on NYSE, General Mills participates in standard tax planning but has not issued public advocacy statements on corporat

free_trade.notes: General Mills sells products globally and has international joint ventures (e.g. Cereal Partners Worldwide with NestlÃ©). Benefits from global trade but no explicit public advocacy stance on free trad

climate_change.notes: General Mills has committed to reducing value chain GHG emissions by 30% by 2030 (vs 2020 baseline) and achieving net zero emissions by 2050. Advancing regenerative agriculture on 1 million acres by 2

renewable_energy.notes: General Mills has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity for all global operations by 2030. This is a verified, publicly stated commitment on company website.

environmental_regulations.notes: General Mills has set ambitious environmental targets and works with NGOs and industry partnerships. Company describes itself as depending on 'a healthy planet.' Has supported sustainable agriculture

animal_rights.notes: In April 2011, General Mills announced it would switch all 1 million eggs it uses annually to cage-free. This was an early, proactive animal welfare commitment predating many industry standards. Compa

gun_control.notes: No public position on gun control or firearms legislation found. General Mills has not lobbied or issued statements on gun policy.

military_spending.notes: No public position on military spending found. General Mills does have veteran employee programs but has not taken a stance on defense budgets.

police_reform.notes: As a Minneapolis-area company, General Mills made public statements about racial equity following George Floyd's death in 2020, but did not specifically endorse police reform legislation. 'Courageous

drug_policy.notes: No public position on drug decriminalization or drug enforcement policy found.

universal_healthcare.notes: No public position on universal healthcare or Medicare-for-All found. General Mills provides employee health benefits but has not advocated for specific healthcare system reform.

education_funding.notes: General Mills has historically supported education through Betty Crocker Box Tops for Education program (running since 1929 in various forms) and community investment in Minneapolis/St. Paul area scho

student_debt.notes: No public position on student debt cancellation or college affordability policy found.

vaccine_policy.notes: No public advocacy stance on vaccine mandates found. During COVID-19, General Mills implemented health protocols for workers but did not publicly lobby for or against vaccine mandates.

abortion.notes: No public position on abortion access or abortion legislation found for Kellogg Company, Kellanova, or WK Kellogg Co. No lobbying on abortion issues documented in public records.

lgbtq_rights.notes: In October 2019, Kellogg's partnered with GLAAD by launching a limited edition 'All Together Cereal' combining six mini cereal boxes to promote anti-bullying and LGBTQ advocacy efforts, donating $50,0

racial_justice.notes: Kellogg Company has diversity and inclusion programs and made public statements after 2020 racial justice events. Company has participated in the HRC Corporate Equality Index and has Employee Resource

immigration.notes: No public position on immigration policy found. Kellogg Company has international operations and employs workers globally but has not taken a public stance on immigration legislation.

religious_liberty.notes: No public position on religious liberty legislation found. Kellogg's roots are in the Seventh-day Adventist tradition (Battle Creek Sanitarium origins), but the modern company has not taken religious

death_penalty.notes: No public position on capital punishment found.

workers_rights.notes: In October 2021, workers at all Kellogg's US cereal plants went on strike over labor contract disputes including a two-tier wage system. On December 3, 2021, a tentative deal was struck but union memb

minimum_wage.notes: No explicit public stance on minimum wage legislation. The 2021 strike context involved a two-tier wage system where new hires would receive lower pay, suggesting resistance to wage parity, though no

corporate_tax.notes: No explicit public position on corporate tax rates found. Kellogg Company lobbied on various trade and regulatory issues but specific corporate tax lobbying not documented in available sources.

free_trade.notes: Kellogg's products were manufactured and marketed in over 180 countries before the 2023 split. Company benefits from global trade but no explicit advocacy position on free trade agreements found.

climate_change.notes: Kellogg Company issued a 'Better Days' global commitment in June 2019 focused on hunger, children, and farmers with targets to reach by 2030. Company had sustainability programs but less ambitious cli

renewable_energy.notes: Kellogg Company had renewable energy goals as part of its sustainability programs. Kellanova (successor) has continued ESG commitments. Specific renewable energy targets were set but are less ambitiou

environmental_regulations.notes: In January 2020, Kellogg's decided to work with suppliers to phase out the use of glyphosate as a drying agent by 2025, responding to consumer and regulatory concerns. This indicates willingness to co

animal_rights.notes: In 2015, Kellogg's announced it would source 100% cage-free eggs and eliminate gestation stalls from its pork supply chain by 2025. Kellogg's also owned Morningstar Farms (vegetarian/vegan brand) and

gun_control.notes: No public position on gun control or firearms legislation found.

military_spending.notes: No public position on military spending or defense budgets found.

police_reform.notes: No public position on police reform found. Kellogg Company issued diversity statements after 2020 events but did not specifically endorse police reform legislation.

drug_policy.notes: No public position on drug decriminalization or drug enforcement policy found.

universal_healthcare.notes: No public position on universal healthcare found. During the 2021 strike, healthcare benefits were part of the contract dispute, but this does not indicate a formal policy position on universal health

education_funding.notes: No public position on education funding policy found. The W.K. Kellogg Foundation (separate from Kellogg Company) is a major educational philanthropy, but the company itself has not lobbied on educati

student_debt.notes: No public position on student debt cancellation or college affordability policy found.

vaccine_policy.notes: No public advocacy stance on vaccine mandates or public health vaccination policy found.

abortion.notes: No public position on abortion access or abortion legislation found. As a private company, Mars Inc. makes fewer public policy statements than publicly traded peers. No lobbying on abortion issues fou

lgbtq_rights.notes: Mars website states: 'No matter the visible or invisible differences, we have long-been committed to fostering an environment where everyone has an equal opportunity to reach their full potential' und

racial_justice.notes: Mars Sustainable in a Generation Plan includes 'society is inclusive' as a core vision. The company has renamed 'Uncle Ben's' to 'Ben's Original' in 2021 to remove racial stereotyping from product bra

immigration.notes: No public position on immigration policy found. Mars human rights policy focuses on supply chain workers, forced labor, and migrant worker protections in its extended supply chain, but does not addres

religious_liberty.notes: No public position on religious liberty legislation found.

death_penalty.notes: No public position on capital punishment found.

workers_rights.notes: Mars has a comprehensive global Human Rights Policy aligned with UN Guiding Principles and ILO Declaration on Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work. Addresses forced labor, child labor, and migran

minimum_wage.notes: Mars has committed to living wages across its operations and supply chain. The 'Increasing Income' pillar of the Sustainable in a Generation Plan explicitly addresses fair compensation. This indicates

corporate_tax.notes: In 2009, Mars hired Ernst & Young to lobby on corporate and international tax issues, including issues related to tax changes proposed by the Obama administration â€” indicating active resistance to p

free_trade.notes: Mars operates globally with manufacturing in 22+ US facilities and extensive international operations. As a company reliant on global commodity supply chains (cocoa, palm oil, sugar), Mars benefits fr

climate_change.notes: Mars Sustainable in a Generation Plan includes a 2050 net zero emissions commitment, science-based actions in support of UN Sustainable Development Goals, and significant investment in transforming ra

renewable_energy.notes: Renewable Energy is explicitly listed as a Healthy Planet priority in Mars' Sustainable in a Generation Plan. Mars is expanding use of renewable energy as part of its path to net zero by 2050.

environmental_regulations.notes: Mars states it is 'building lasting partnerships with NGOs, governments and industry, to help transform the systems' causing environmental problems. Company supports deforestation-free supply chains a

animal_rights.notes: In 2007, Mars announced it would use animal rennet (from calf stomach lining) in UK products. After significant consumer backlash led by the Vegetarian Society, Mars reversed course and switched to al

gun_control.notes: No public position on gun control or firearms legislation found.

military_spending.notes: No public position on military spending or defense budgets found.

police_reform.notes: No public position on police reform found.

drug_policy.notes: No public position on drug decriminalization or drug enforcement policy found.

universal_healthcare.notes: No public position on universal healthcare policy found. Mars does provide employee health benefits and 'Nourishing Wellbeing' is listed as a sustainability pillar, but this refers to nutrition and he

education_funding.notes: No public position on government education funding policy found. Mars does invest in community programs and training for supply chain farmers but has not lobbied on education spending.

student_debt.notes: No public position on student debt cancellation or college affordability policy found.

vaccine_policy.notes: No public advocacy stance on vaccine mandates found. As a private company, Mars has not made public statements on vaccination policy.
